oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Reparation claim against US government for destruction of Hardeman County courthouse
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: General Sturgess and his command entered Bolivar on May 2, 1864 and left on May 5, torching and "utterly destroying" the brick courthouse. This claim was filed the commissioner's court of Hardeman County for reparation in the amount of $15,000 from the US government for damages done by Union troops to local government structures. This claim details the episode it was rejected.
